conbody.p: Several of the document output types supported by the DITA Open Toolkit use CascadingStyleSheets, or CSS. This functionality enables organizations to use different CSSt for dirent documents in their documentation suite. This functionality is available when the toolkit runs as part of your organization's build process that automatically generates your documentation.

The following CSS style class attributes can be specified in a .ditaval file:
underline
double-underline
italics
overline
bold
strike-through
The toolkit also supports changebars as part of filtering content by document revision. Revised content, as marked with changebars, may be filtered using the following CSS class attributes.

The following are valid values for the Placement attribute:
start
end
left
right
inside
outside
alternate

The following are valid values for the Style attribute:
none
hidden
dotted
dashed
solid
double
groove
ridge
inset
outset
conbody.note: Separate the values you assign to a single attribute with a colon. Separate attributes should be separated by a semi-colon. For example, changebar="style:dotted;width:3pt;offset:5pt"
conbody.p: .ditavalfiles are used to filter content in your documents, much as you would filter the contents of your email Inbox.
